name: basichat
description: basic chat LLM (Converted from Langflow Store for AxieStudio compatibility)

code.value:
from typing import Optional, Union

from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.field_typing import Text
from axiestudio.schema import Record


class ChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Output"
    description = "Display a chat message in the Playground."
    icon = "ChatOutput"

    def build(
        self,
        sender: Optional[str] = "Machine",
        sender_name: Optional[str] = "AI",
        input_value: Optional[str] = None,
        session_id: Optional[str] = None,
        return_record: Optional[bool] = False,
        record_template: Optional[str] = "{text}",
    ) -> Union[Text, Record]:
        return super().build_with_record(
            sender=sender,
            sender_name=sender_name,
            input_value=input_value,
            session_id=session_id,
            return_record=return_record,
            record_template=record_template or "",
        )
code.name: code

record_template.name: record_template
record_template.info: In case of Message being a Record, this template will be used to convert it to text.

return_record.name: return_record
return_record.info: Return the message as a record containing the sender, sender_name, and session_id.

session_id.name: session_id
session_id.info: If provided, the message will be stored in the memory.

node.description: Display a chat message in the Playground.

code.value:
from typing import Optional, Union

from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.field_typing import Text
from axiestudio.schema import Record


class ChatInput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Input"
    description = "Get chat inputs from the Playground."
    icon = "ChatInput"

    def build_config(self):
        build_config = super().build_config()
        build_config["input_value"] = {
            "input_types": [],
            "display_name": "Message",
            "multiline": True,
        }

        return build_config

    def build(
        self,
        sender: Optional[str] = "User",
        sender_name: Optional[str] = "User",
        input_value: Optional[str] = None,
        session_id: Optional[str] = None,
        return_record: Optional[bool] = False,
    ) -> Union[Text, Record]:
        return super().build_no_record(
            sender=sender,
            sender_name=sender_name,
            input_value=input_value,
            session_id=session_id,
            return_record=return_record,
        )
code.name: code

return_record.name: return_record
return_record.info: Return the message as a record containing the sender, sender_name, and session_id.

session_id.name: session_id
session_id.info: If provided, the message will be stored in the memory.

node.description: Get chat inputs from the Playground.

code.name: code

max_tokens.name: max_tokens
max_tokens.info: The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.

openai_api_base.name: openai_api_base
openai_api_base.info:
The base URL of the OpenAI API. Defaults to https://api.openai.com/v1.

You can change this to use other APIs like JinaChat, LocalAI and Prem.

openai_api_key.name: openai_api_key
openai_api_key.info: The OpenAI API Key to use for the OpenAI model.

stream.name: stream
stream.info: Stream the response from the model. Streaming works only in Chat.

system_message.name: system_message
system_message.info: System message to pass to the model.

from typing import Optional, Union

from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.field_typing import Text
from axiestudio.schema import Record


class ChatInput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Input"
    description = "Get chat inputs from the Playground."
    icon = "ChatInput"

    def build_config(self):
        build_config = super().build_config()
        build_config["input_value"] = {
            "input_types": [],
            "display_name": "Message",
            "multiline": True,
        }

        return build_config

    def build(
        self,
        sender: Optional[str] = "User",
        sender_name: Optional[str] = "User",
        input_value: Optional[str] = None,
        session_id: Optional[str] = None,
        return_record: Optional[bool] = False,
    ) -> Union[Text, Record]:
        return super().build_no_record(
            sender=sender,
            sender_name=sender_name,
            input_value=input_value,
            session_id=session_id,
            return_record=return_record,
        )
